snippet: Critics have raised an outcry over Sovaldi, a hepatitis C drug heralded as a breakthrough but costing $84,000 for a typical person’s total treatment.
abstract: The Upshot column; critics have raised an outcry over hepatitis C drug Sovaldi, heralded as a breakthrough but costing $1,000 a pill and about $84,000 for a typical person’s total treatment; drug from maker Gilead Sciences cures about 90 percent of patients who take it; advocates say quick cure for hepatitis C can cost a lot less than a lifetime of treatments for other diseases.
lead_paragraph: Critics have raised an outcry over Sovaldi, a hepatitis C drug heralded as a breakthrough but costing $84,000 for a typical person’s total treatment.

headline.print_headline: Is a $1,000 Pill Really Too Much?
headline.main: $1,000 Hepatitis Pill Shows Why Fixing Health Costs Is So Hard
